review_blob: Clear ruby beer with an off-white head and a sour fruity aroma. Flavour is tangy fruit, a sour berry hit and theres a bit of malt to mellow those out a bit. Its tart enough that I wouldnt be rushing back for more but its quite tasty.

Clear yellow beer with a white head. Light, sweet hop aroma. Dry, light citrus flavour. Its pretty mellow as you might expect from the strength of it, but its got a nice clean taste and a zingy, lemony aftertaste and itd really hit the spot as a session beer.
Hazy dark golden beer with a white head and a dry, zesty aroma. Crisp, citrus and hop taste. Nice and dry in both flavour and finish.

Dark, red-brown beer with a beige head and a smell of fruit, malt and caramel. Flavour is sweet and rich. Malt, fruit, caramel, a touch of hop so its not just sweetness and the aftertaste has a bit of a lingering bitterness to it as well. This is a very nice beer.
beer_name: De Dochter van de Korenaar Embrasse

review_blob: Dark beer with a thin head. Earthy malt scent. Flavour has the same bitter malt, rich chocolate and a bit of coffee in there too. Rather tasty.
Pale golden beer with a light head. Sweet fruity aroma, grapefruity hop flavour. Nicely crisp and refreshing. The grapefruit lingers with a long aftertaste. Really nice.
Golden beer, fruity aroma. Taste is sweet, fruity. A bit sickly. Too sweet for my taste but its not bad.
Clear golden beer with a white head. Light citrus smell. Flavour is light, lemony hop with a decent bitter, slightly sour aftertaste. Not amazing but nice enough.

Hazy pale yellow beer with a white head and a sour, yeasty smell. Flavour is about as sour as I care to go. Not overly so, its got hop, grassy citrus and tangy fruit but theres a tart, sour taste to it throughout. Perhaps not one Id dash back to often but very nice all the same.

This one doesnt taste of enough to be really good or bad. I just had it with a spicy burrito so I suppose for want of a better option it hits the mark. Pale lager, bit watery but crisp and refreshing enough in its place.

Hazy golden beer with a whtie head and bready, banana-y smell. Sharp on the tongue both due to the carbonation a bit of a zingy citrus hit. Banana, yeast and hops in there too. Perect for a warm day, this is a really good hefeweizen. The taste of banana lingers in the aftertaste.

Hazy golden beer with a thick, lively head. Wheaty banana smell. Lively on the tongue, theres banana and hop in the flavour. Sharp, crisp rather drinkable. Theres not that much to say other than that its a decent, very drinkable white beer.

Golden beer with a white head. Sweet fruity smell. Kick of lemony hop up front but it does get a bit drier and mellow out a bit. Balances quite nicely and theres a mellow fruity spice taste that hangs around too. Very drinkable.
Black beer with a bitter, malty scent. Tastes of earthy malts and creamy chocolate which adds a touch of sweetness and mellows it out a bit. The chocolate lingers in the aftertaste. Very drinkable.

Dark beer with a beige, bubbly head. Mine looked a bit flat and the head disappears but thats a bit misleading. Malty chocolate dominates the smell and the flavour. Feels a bit watery both in the mouth and the finish but its decent enough.

beer_brewer_name: Exit 33 (prev Skys Edge & The Brew Company)
review_blob: Golden beer, white head. Lemon and grapefruit throughout the aroma and the taste, with some hoppiness to give it a bit of depth. Nothing special but pleasant enough.
Clear golden beer with a white head, a smell of grapefruit and crisp, citrus flavour. Aftertaste is pleasingly bitter and the whole thing is crisp and refreshing.

Golden beer, white head, sweet citrusy hop, a dash of malt and a slightly creamy feel to it. Theres absolutely nothing wrong with it but nor would I be rushing back for another. Its just a standard, pleasant enough golden ale.

Cloudy red-brown. Very faint malt aroma. Flavour is bitter with a hit of malt and theres a good whack of chocolate in there too. Lively on the tongue. Not much of a backtaste. Its nice but somehow a touch unsubstantial.

Opaque reddish brown beer with a rich, malty fruit aroma. Taste is very strong. Rich malt, fruit (apple maybe, a touch of something sour), a bit of bitter hop. Aftertaste is more of the sour fruit and very nice.
Clear golden beer with a white head. Flavour is hoppy citrus. Strong taste of grapefruit to it. Has a lingering, dry, citrus finish. Very drinkable.

Clear amber beer with a white head and late malty aroma. Flavour is a fairly standard bitter but with a nice, light twist of citrus in there. Aftertaste is quite dry. Nothing special but perfectly drinkable, a good session beer.
Clear golden beer with a white head and a bitter citrus aroma. Tastes is bitter hoppy, grapefruit and lemon. Dry, tart finish. Could have gone being a mite cooler but night.
Clear red beer with a light fruit scent. Taste is sweet fruit, a dash of hop and has a bit of a sickly edge. A bit of citrus in the aftertaste.

Hazy brown ale with a thin head a smell that, were I blindfolded, Id identify as whisky. Flavour is a touch more balanced. Theres some malt and hop kicking about but theres still a very smoky, peaty quality to it. To be quite honest, I think Id rather just have a whisky than have a beer that tastes so strongly of it. Its not bad at all, I just dont think its really to my taste. Theres of malty, woody sweetness in there but it doesnt really taste like a beer. I enjoyed it well enough but I wouldnt rush back.

Lively amber beer with a thin beige head. Aroma of sour fruit and malt. Sweet malty hit up front, some tartness in there too. Theres a bit of a hoppy kick with the fruit as well. A bit of liqourice in the aftertaste as well, which Im not a huge fan of.
beer_name: Buxton / Oedipus / Oproer Ring Your Mother 1832 XXXX Mild

review_blob: Clear golden beer with a thin head. Actually smells a bit like white chocolate. A touch fruity too. Flavour is odd. Sugary sweetness, some malt and hop. Aftertaste is a bit more bitter, perhaps even slightly sour. It doesnt really meet the deScription though I suppose if blindfolded and told it was a stout I might not argue. Not bad.

Slightly hazy golden beer with a thick white head. Floral, grassy aroma of tropical fruit and hops. Flavour has a really grassy quality too. A dry, tangy flavour. Bitter grapefruit, hops. I should have chilled it a bit longer. Session beer always feels like a bit of a backhanded compliment to me but this really fits the bill. Loads of flavour and yet only 3.8%. Lovely beer.

Hazy amber beer with a white foamy head. Bready banana aroma. Flavour has the same qualities
 Banana, doughy bread, a hint of citrus hop. Sharp on the tongue. I could drink this all day.

Hazy golden beer with a distinct basil/herb aroma, with just a dash of lemon cutting through it. Flavour reverses that a bit. Theres more prominence to the hop and citrus in the flavour but theres still a herby dryness to it and it has a strong savoury quality to it. Im not sure how to rate this one. I cant lie and say Id rush back for more but Im really pleased to have tried it. Odd one though. This might match perfectly with some food but Im not sure if Id ever fancy it other than that.
beer_name: Pilot Beer Citrus and Basil Sharp

review_blob: Cloudy brown beer with a filmy white head. Tart fruit and an actual whiff of custard to the aroma. The flavour matches the title but manages to avoid feeling like a misplaced pudding with a yeasty, malt hit to it as well. Flavour is quite rich but the beer keeps a cool, crisp feel. Really good.

Brown beer with a bubbly off-white head. Sour, spicy aroma of yeast and fruit. The initial flavour is tangy fruit (raisins, theres a Christmas cake-y quality to it), theres a bready yeast taste too. Sharp and lively in the mouth. Really good.

Clear red beer with a thin filmy head. A bit of fruit and some caramel in the smell. A touch drier than I expected in the taste. Same qualities as the aroma but theres a touch of bitter hop in there too and a sharp feeling on the tongue.

Clear dark red beer with an off-white head and a malty fruit aroma. Flavour follows the same pattern. Sharp on the tongue with fruit (maybe apple with some berry-type flavours) and a bit of hearty malt. Aftertaste is a touch watery but its thoroughly drinkiable.

Black beer with an off-white head and a light, malty aroma. Flavour is lighter than I expected to. Earthy malt, bitter chocolate, some coffee as well.theres a bit of fruitiness in the aftertaste too. Its not spectacular but its a good, tasty stout and I could happily sit and have a few (though the 6.5% might be an issue on that front!)

Hazy amber beer with a white head and a sweet, citrusy hop smell. Its sharp bitter hop on the tongue and tropical fruit in the back of the mouth. Something like mango, perhaps. Its very well balanced and very suppable.

Clear golden beer with a thick white head and a light lemony aroma. Flavour initially seems a touch watery but it really follows through and becomes much more interesting. Bitter hop, a touch of tropical fruit, some sour, flowery notes. A pleasant surprise after that first taste. Very drinkable.
Black stout with a beige head. Rich, earthy malt aroma. Flavour is bitter chocolate, a dash of coffee, rich malt. Really very nice.
Clear amber beer with a white head. Light hoppy aroma but not much of anything. Flavour has a bit of the same with a dash of citrus fruit but its pretty unremarkable.

Clear golden beer with a white head. Aroma is light citrus hop. Flavour follows suit: tart, grapefruity, bitter hop, a splash of malt comes through as well. For the strength and style its quite crisp and not sickly. Could perhaps have been chilled a bit more.
Black beer with a thin head. Scent is superb: malt, chocolate, coffee, caramel. Taste follows this up, with all of that beautifully balanced. Aftertaste is ever so slightly sour.

(Cask at Blackfriars in Glasgow) Clear golden beer with a very thin head. Light sour fruit aroma. Taste is citrus with some hippy bitterness coming through. Its a touch watery to be honest but the flavour is nice and it has a solid grapefruit aftertaste so I could happily drink a few.
Clear, dark red beer with a light malt aroma. Taste is a fairly traditional bitter. Bitter malt, a touch of hop and some fruitiness in there. Bit of toffee too. Unremarkable but drinkable.
Clear amber beer. Little aroma. Very light malty fruit taste. Doesnt taste of a huge amount to be honest. Bit surprised at that from this brewery. Its not bad its just really bland.
Golden beer. Light floral, fruity aroma. Taste has a sharper hit of grapefruit citrus. Mellows out quite a bit. If the flavour had lingered more Id have liked it better. Solid though.
Light hoppy aroma. Flavour has a bit of citrus hop and a slightly sickly aftertaste. Its a bog standard bitter really. Drinkable but nowt special.
Clear brown beer. Fruity malt aroma. Fruity malt flavour as well with a bit of citrus kick. Quite rich. Very nice.

Hazy amber beer. I tried to leave most of the sediment in the bottle. Aroma is dry, bitter citrus and hop. Flavour is much the same. Grapefruit is the dominant flavour but its not overbearing or bitter and tart. In fact, its quite a refreshing beer. Lingering hop flavour, fairly hearty in the mouth. Itd be nearly perfect for a hot day were it not for the strength.

Clear amber beer with a thin white head and a malty toffee aroma. Flavour is actually slightly disappointing and Im wondering if I over-chilled it and thats dulled the flavours somewhat. The toasted malt and toffee are still there and being chilled makes it crisp and very drinkable but theres not a heck of a lot of oomph to the taste. Not bad though.

Crystal clear yellow beer with a white head. Faint, bitter hop smell. Flavour is just..... a decent if unspectacular lager. Crisp, no sickliness to it as you get with some too-sweet lagers. Drinkable but forgettable.
